body: Hm, do we have a hole in our CI? Do you happen to know the fix?
The fix seems easy, since it produces the inconsistency of attribute of `interface` due to 114d97c. (the error message just gives the solution).

issue.title: build: Fix compilation issues on macOS

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
close: https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/2695

The test on GitHub CI is a bit strange. `cargo nextest run --locked --workspace --features native-tls` should fail. It does happen on my macOS, but GitHub CI passes.

I guess it's a problem with setting up the compilation cache.

issue.title: fix: pin the reqwest version until the compilation issue is resolved
issue.body:
Seems to be a new .16 version issue that should be resolved soon, but currently fails our CI.

https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/2695

body: Sorry about that, v0.12.17 is out now.

> Sorry about that, v0.12.17 is out now.

How about yanking `0.12.16` to avoid it been used?
I don't see a need to yank, if someone upgraded and it didn't fail to compile, they're fine.

> Hm, do we have a hole in our CI? Do you happen to know the fix?

Sorry about taking so long to get back on this - I unfortunately don't have a mac or OSX machine to investigate further, however the attached fixes above are the ones I would have suggested for this issue.

issue.title: Reqwest version
issue.body:
This one is already fixed: https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/2695, so we can switch back to using 0.12 version of reqwest.


Related PR: https://github.com/logos-co/nomos/pull/1297
